entries.name: Age
entries: Gnoll mature and age at about the same rate as humans.

entries.name: Size
entries: Gnoll are typically over 6 feet tall, with some standing over 7 feet. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your fangs are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you can deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Hunter's Instincts
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Survival}.

entries.name: Rampage
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, as a bonus action you can move up to half your speed and make a {@i bite} attack.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnoll.
You have a {=bonusAc} bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

You can also use a bonus action to speak the armor's command word and cause the armor to assume the appearance of a normal set of clothing or some other kind of armor. You decide what it looks like, including color, style, and accessories, but the armor retains its normal bulk and weight. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this property again or remove the armor.
You have a {=bonusAc} bonus to AC while wearing this armor.
While wearing this armor you are immune to the effects of severe weather.
When you are in severe cold, you have resistance to fire damage, Inversely, you have resistance to cold damage while in severe heat.
You have adantage on any Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks made while wearing this armor.

You can use a bonus action to speak this magic sword's command word, causing icicles to erupt from the blade. These icicles shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the sword is afrost, it deals an extra {@dice 3d6} cold damage to any target it hits. The icicles last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword.

From beyond the stars, a Great Old One whispers promises of reality-defying knowledge and world-bending power. When a wizard or a warlock hears that whisper and listens too intently, they might set foot on the twisting path toward becoming an eldritch lich.

Like other liches, eldritch liches are spellcasters who have cheated death, but an eldritch lich does so by allowing a Great Old One to implant a Far Realm parasite in the lich. That parasite bestows undeath upon the spellcaster and causes strange tentacles to sprout from the body. The parasite's mouth is visible on the lich's torso, and the parasite guards the lich against destruction, reviving the lich a few days after death. Canny foes can sabotage an eldritch lich's revival by slaying the lich in a magic circle, thereby forcing the lich to return in a distorted form, robbed of most of its power.
An eldritch lich constantly hears bizarre whispers from the Far Realm, to which the lich nods and mutters. Occasionally, the lich uses its telepathy to share those whispers with the minds around it.

entries.name: Form of the Great Old One
entries: Multiple entities bear the title Great Old One. You may roll on the Great Old Ones table to determine which entity gave an eldritch lich its parasite.

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs Caliope no extra movement. They can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.
In addition Caliope has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such those created by the {@spell entangle} spell.

trait.name: Hoard Breaker (1/Turn)
entries: When Caliope makes a weapon attack, they can make another attack with the same weapon against another creature within 5 feet of the original target.

trait.name: Favored Enemy
entries: Caliope ha advantage on Intelligence checks to recall information about and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track Fey, Goblinoids, and Humanoids.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Caliope's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Caliope is a 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). Caliope has the following ranger spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Caliope makes two attacks.

action.name: Rapier, +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Slumbering Dragon's Wrath Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage. On a 20 on an attack roll with this weapon, each creature the Caliope chooses within 5 feet of the target takes 5 ice damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Twin Weapon Fighting
entries: When holding 2 weapons, Caliope can make a weapon attack.

monster.name: Regina Caigwyn

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: The Ice Queen can attempt to hide even when only lightly obscured.

trait.name: Voice of Authority
entries: When the Ice Queen casts a spell of 1st level or higher that targets an ally, that ally can make one weapon attack as a reaction against a creature of the Ice Queen's choice.

trait.name: War Caster
entries: The Ice Queen has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on a spell.

trait.name: Cloak of Arachnida
entries: The Ice Queen can move across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving their hands free and can't be caught in webs of any sort and can move through webs as if they were difficult terrain.

trait.name: Tyrant's Subjugation
entries: Creatures have disadvantage on saving throws and ability checks made to avoid being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by the Ice Queen.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Ice Queen can cast the following spells innately (spell save {@dc 13}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Ice Queen is a 16th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The Ice Queen has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Nighteye Dagger (Haask the Voice of Hargut)
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 11 ({@damage 1d4 + 9}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage. On a hit the attack does an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and the targets speed is reduced by 10ft. for one minute.

action.name: Haask's Presence (1/Day)
entries: The Ice Queen transforms into a Tiny, leech-like being and teleports onto the shoulder of a humanoid that it can see within 30 feet of it. The targeted humanoid must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the Ice Queen. While the target is charmed, the Ice Queen has control of it on the target's next turn. At the end of that turn, the Ice Queen teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it and returns to its normal form. The Ice Queen can't be targeted directly by any attack or other effect while it's in the slug-like form, but it is subject to areas of effect as normal. This ability can be used as a bonus action after the wielder makes a successful weapon attack with the {@i {@b Nighteye Dagger (Haask the Voice of Hargut)}}, forcing the target of the attack to make the saving throw.
When the Ice Queen uses this ability they take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Divine Intervention (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The Ice Queen requests Helm's aid and has a 16% chance of succeeding. If successful, the Ice Queen can't use this feature again for 7 days, otherwise.

action.name: Channel Divinity (2/Short Rest)
entries: The Ice Queen uses their Channel Divinity in one of the following ways.

items.name: {@b Order's Demand}
items.entry: Each creature of choice within 30 feet of the Ice Queen must succeed a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the end of their next turn or until the charmed creature takes any damage. The Ice Queen can also cause any of the charmed creatures to drop what they are holding.

items.name: {@b Turn Undead}
items.entry: Each undead within 30 feet of the Ice Queen must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature spends its turns moving as far away from the Ice Queen as it can, can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of the Ice Queen, take reactions, and only take the dash action, escape from an effect that prevents it from moving, or take the Dodge action if there's nowhere to move. When an undead of CR {@b 3} or lower fails its saving throw, the creature is instantly destroyed.

bonus.name: Embodiment of the Law (5/Long Rest)
entries: The Ice Queen casts an enchantment spell of of 1st level or higher with the casting time of 1 action.

reaction.name: War Caster
entries: When a creature's provokes an opportunity attack, the Ice Queen can cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack.

legendaryHeader: The Ice Queen can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Ice Queen regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Disengage
entries: The Ice Queen takes the disengage action.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Ice Queen makes a melee weapon attack.

legendary.name: Intimidate (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Ice Queen chooses a creature within 30 ft. and makes a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check contested by the target's Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. On failure the target is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Richter has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If Richter surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Richter deals an extra 17 ({@damage 5d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack if they don't have disadvantage on the attack roll and one of the following:

items: Richter has advantage on the attack roll,
The target is within 5 ft. of an ally of Richter that isn't {@condition incapacitated}
Richter is within 5 ft. of the target and no other creatures are within 5 ft. of Richter.

trait.name: Rakish Audacity
entries: Richter has a {@b +5} bonus to initiative rolls.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Richter is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Fancy Footwork
entries: If Richter makes a melee attack against a creature during their turn, that creature can't make opportunity attacks against Richter for the rest of their turn.

trait.name: Jack of All Trades
entries: Richter adds {@b +2} to any ability check they aren't proficient in.

trait.name: Silver Tongue
entries: When making a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) or Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks, Richter treats a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Richter is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). Richter has the following Bard spells prepared:

action.name: Rapier of Wounding
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage. Damage done by this weapon can only be regained through a short or long rest.

Once per turn, when this weapon hits a creature, the become wounded. At the start of their turn, the wounded creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage for each time it's been wounded. It can then make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or the target or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check, ending the effect of all such wounds on itself on a success.

action.name: Shortbow, +1
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Panache
entries: Richter can make a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check contested by a creature's Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check if they both share a language. If Richter succeeds and the creature is

items.name: Hostile
items.entry: It has disadvantage on attack rolls and can't make opportunity attacks against anyone other than Richter for one minute or until the target is 60 feet away.

items.name: Non-hostile
items.entry: It is {@condition charmed} by Richter for 1 minute or until Richter or their companions do anything harmful to it.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, Richter can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

bonus.name: Bardic Inspiration (3/Long Rest)
entries: Another creature within 60 ft. of Richter gains an inspiration die 3 ({@damage 1d6}), and can add it to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw after seeing the roll, but before knowing the outcome.

bonus.name: Unsettling Words
entries: Richter can expend one use of their Bardic Inspiration and choose one creature within 60 ft. must subtract 3 ({@damage 1d6}) from its next saving throw it makes before the start of Richter's next turn.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker hits Richter with an attack, they can halve the attack's damage.

trait.name: Blade Flourish (1/Turn)
entries: Whenever Neatred takes the Attack action, their walking speed increases by 10 feet until the end of the turn, and can expend one use of their Bardic Inspiration to use a Blade Flourish option:

items.name: {@i {@b Defensive Flourish}}
items.entry: Neatred cause the weapon to deal extra damage to the target equal to the number rolled on the Inspiration die and add the number rolled to his AC until the start of his next turn.

items.name: {@i {@b Mobile Flourish}}
items.entry: Neatred cause the weapon to deal extra damage to the target equal to the number rolled on the Inspiration die and push the target up to a number equal to roll + 5 feet away. Neatred can then use his reaction to move up to his walking speed to within 5 feet of the target.

items.name: {@i {@b Slashing Flourish}}
items.entry: Neatred cause the weapon to deal extra damage to the target any other creature of his choice within 5 feet equal to the number rolled on the Inspiration die.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Long or Short Rest)
entries: {@i Neatred} can take one additional action on their turn.

trait.name: Jack of All Trades
entries: Neatred adds {@b +2} to any ability check they aren't proficient in.

trait.name: Mage Slayer
entries: When Neatred damages a creature that is concentrating on a spell, that creature has disadvantage on the concentration check. Neatred has advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures within 5 feet.

trait.name: Know Your Enemy
entries: If Neatred spends at least 1 minute observing or interacting with a creature outside combat, they gain insight on  if the creature is their equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the following characteristics:

items: Strength score
Dexterity score
Constitution score
Armor Class
Current hit points
Total class levels (if any)
Fighter class levels (if any)

trait.name: Combat Superiority (5d8/Long Rest)
entries: Neatred can use the following abilities:

items.name: {@i {@b Trip Attack}}
items.entry: When Neatred hits with a weapon attack they add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll. They can force a Large or smaller target to succeed a 16 {@dc Strength} saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: {@i {@b Disarming Attack}}
items.entry: When Neatred hits with a weapon attack they add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll. They can force the target to succeed a 16 {@dc Strength} saving throw or drop the object they choose. The object lands at its feet.

items.name: {@i {@b Maneuvering Attack}}
items.entry: When Neatred hits with a weapon attack they add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll. They can choose a friendly creature who can see or hear them to use its reaction to move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks from the target of Neatred's attack.

items.name: {@i {@b Bait and Switch}}
items.entry: On their turn, Neatred can use 5 feet of movement to switch places with a willing creature within 5 feet. Neatred can roll a superiority die and add the total to either creature's AC.

items.name: {@i {@b Goading Attack}}
items.entry: When Neatred hits with a weapon attack they add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll. They can force the target to succeed a 16 {@dc Wisdom} saving throw or the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than Neatred until the end of his next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Neatred makes two attacks.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Goring Rush
entries: After using the Dash action and moving at least 20 feet, Neatred can make one {@b {@i Horns}} attack as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Hammering Horns
entries: After hitting a creature with a melee attack, if that creature is within 5 feet of Neatred, they can force that target to succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Neatred can to regain 13 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) HP.

bonus.name: Bardic Inspiration (4/Long Rest)
entries: Another creature within 60 ft. of Neatred gains an inspiration die 3 ({@damage 1d6}), and can add it to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw after seeing the roll, but before knowing the outcome.

reaction.name: Mage Slayer
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of Neatred casts a spell, they can make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

monster.name: Veldarin, Archmage of Alyentlea
immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Veldarin's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Unless he wishes to be affected, Veldarin is immune to spells of 4th level or lower. He has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: If Veldarin has at least 1 hit point, he regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn.

trait.name: Arch-Caster
entries: Veldarin has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on a spell. Veldarin does not have to make Concentration checks unless they receive more than {@b 40} hit points of damage.

trait.name: Aura of Undiscernability
entries: While Veldarin is wielding the {@i {@b Shadow Gauntlets}}, a creature that starts it's turn within 20 feet of Veldarin must succeed on a {@dc 27} Wisdom saving throw, unless Veldarin is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is forced to question the metaphysical nature of Veldarin until the start of its next turn. Until this ends, the target can't take actions or reactions, and its speed is 0 and can't be increased. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to Veldarin's {@i Aura of Undiscernability} for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Discorporation
entries: when Veldarin drops to 0 hit points or dies, his body is destroyed but his essence travels back to his domain the Feywild, and is unable to take physical form for a time.

trait.name: Improved Minor Illusion
entries: {@spell Minor illusion} cast by Veldarin can create both a sound and an image with a single casting of the spell.

trait.name: Illusory Reality
entries: When Veldarin casts an illusion spell of 1st level or higher, one inanimate, nonmagical object that is part of the illusion can be made real. This can be done as a bonus action while the spell is ongoing. It lasts for 1 minute and can not deal damage or otherwise directly harm anyone.

trait.name: Illusory Aspects
entries: Veldarin's thoughts cannot be read and they cannot be affected by divination spells.

trait.name: Convincing Illusions
entries: Illusion spells cast by Veldarin that would fail physical inspection, can now pass as real.

trait.name: Illusionist's Cunning
entries: Illusion spells cast by the Archmage of Alyentlea gains all effects as if it was cast with a spell slot one level higher, up to a maximum of 9th level.

trait.name: Illusory Trickery (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Archmage of Alyentlea is permanently affected by {@spell nystul's magic aura}, gaining both its effects.

trait.name: Prismatic Juggle
entries: When Veldarin casts a spell with a spell slot, that isn't of the same school as the previous spell they cast, within a minute of the last casting, the new spell is cast as if it is one level higher.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Veldarin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}, {@hit 17} to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spell Mastery
headerEntries: Veldarin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 27}, {@hit 19} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Ritual Casting
headerEntries: Veldarin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 27}, {@hit 19} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells at will, taking 10 minutes longer to cast than normal:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Veldarin is an 30th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 27}, {@hit 19} to hit with spell attacks). Veldarin has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *illusion spell of first level or higher

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Veldarin attacks twice with his {@b {@i Shadow Gauntlets}} and uses his {@b {@i Mental Stunting}}.

action.name: Shadow Gauntlets
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 5d8 + 7}) psychic damage. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 27} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is forced to question the metaphysical nature of Veldarin until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Spatially Unbound
entries: Veldarin magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

action.name: Malleable Illusions
entries: Veldarin changes the nature of illusion spells with a duration of 1 minute or longer, (using the spell's normal parameters for the illusion), if they can see the illusion.

action.name: Mental Stunting
entries: Veldarin uses illusions to physically overwhelm one creature he can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 31 ({@damage 6d6 + 10}) cold damage, can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, but not both. These effects last for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.

bonus.name: Illusory Trickery (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Archmage of Alyentlea can invoke an illusory duplicate of themself as if they had cast the {@spell mirror image} spell.

bonus.name: Deep Memory (2/Long Rest)
entries: Veldarin can exchange one memorized spell for any other spell.

bonus.name: Archmage
entries: Veldarin conjures a meta physical spellbook that only they can open and read. The book contains all wizard spells and has an infinite number of pages.

bonus.name: Swift Caster
entries: While wielding the {@b {@i Shadow Gauntlets}}, Veldarin can cast a spell that has a casting time of one action.

reaction.name: War Caster
entries: When a creature's provokes an opportunity attack, Veldarin can cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack.

reaction.name: Illusory Self (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When a creature makes an attack roll against Veldarin they can create an illusory duplicate of themselves causing that attack to miss.

legendaryHeader: The Archmage of Alyentlea can take 5 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Veldarin regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Mental Stunting
entries: Veldarin uses his {@b {@i Mental Stunting}}.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Asmodeus uses his Teleport action.

legendary.name: Manipulate Intrigue
entries: Veldarin targets one creature that is his nature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target uses its reaction to move up to half its speed and make one weapon attack against a creature of Veldarin choice that he can see.

legendary.name: Shadow Gauntlets (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Veldarin attacks with his {@b {@i Shadow Gauntlets}}.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 1-5 Actions)
entries: Veldarin expends a spell slot to cast a 1st-, 2nd-, 3rd-, 4th-, or 5th-level spell that he has prepared. Doing so costs 1 legendary action per level of the spell.

legendary.name: Summon Night Elf Matron (Costs 4 Actions)
entries: Veldarin magically summons a {@creature Drow Matron Mother|MTF}. The elf appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of Veldarin, acts as Veldarin's ally, and can summon other elves if it has such power. The elf remains until Veldarin dies or until he dismisses it as an action.

trait.name: Aura of Courage
entries: Captain Tefor and friendly creatures within 10 ft. can’t be {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Aura of Liberation
entries: While not {@condition incapacitated}, Captain Tefor and creatures of the choose within 10 ft. cannot be {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}, and ignore penalties on movement and attacks while underwater. Creatures that were already grappled or restrained when entering the aura can spend 5 ft. of movement to automatically escape nonmagical restraints.

trait.name: Aura of Protection
entries: Captain Tefor grants all friendly creatures within 10 ft. a +3 bonus to all saving throws.

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: When Captain Tefor hits with a melee weapon attack, they can expend one spell slot to deal 9 ({@damage 2d8}) extra radiant damage to the target plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) for each spell level higher than 1st and and additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) against undead or fiends.

trait.name: Divine Health
entries: Captain Tefor is immune to disease.

trait.name: Leviathan Will
entries: The Captain Tefor has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, {@condition stunned}, or put to sleep.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: Captain Tefor can breathe air and water, but must be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Trident of Fish Command (3/Day)
entries: Captain Tefor can innately cast {@spell dominate beast} (spell save {@dc 15}), requiring no material components.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Captain Tefor is a 15th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Captain Tefor has the following paladin spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Captain Tefor makes two attacks.

action.name: Trident of Fish Control
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Channel Divinity (2/Short Rest)
entries: The Captain Tefor uses their Channel Divinity in one of the following ways.

items.name: {@b Marine Layer}
items.entry: Captain Tefor creates a thick cloud of fog that surrounds them and heavily obscures the area for 20 ft. in all directions, following as they move. Captain Tefor and all creatures within 5 ft. of them treats this fog as lightly obscured. This fog lasts 10 minutes, spreads around corners, and cannot be dispersed unless they choose to end it.

items.name: {@b Fury of the Tides}
items.entry: As a bonus action, Captain Tefor channels the powerful might of the waves to bolster their attacks for 1 minute. Once per turn for the duration, when they hit a creature with a weapon attack, they can push the target 10 ft. away. If pushed into an obstacle or another creature, the target takes +3 bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Cleansing Touch (5/Long Rest)
entries: The Captain Tefor ends one spell on themself or on a willing creature that they touch.

action.name: Divine Sense (6/Long Rest)
entries: Until the end of The Captain Tefor's next turn, they can sense anything affected by the hallow spell or know the location of any celestial, fiend, undead within 60 ft. that is not behind total cover.

action.name: Lay on Hands Pool (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The Captain Tefor have a pool of healing power that can restore 75 HP. The Captain Tefor can touch a creature to restore any number of HP remaining in the pool, or 5 HP to either cure a disease or neutralize a poison affecting the creature.

reaction.name: Stormy Waters
entries: When a creature that enters or exits Captain Tefor's melee range, it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed on a STR saving throw ({@dc 16}) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Lion of Tefor can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The Lion of Tefor has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the Lion of Tefor moves at least 25 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a headbash attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or lose any breathe it was holding. The Lion of Tefor can attempt to grapple the target as a bonus action.

action.name: Headbash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Relentless Rage
entries: If RAAAGH drops to 0 hit points while raging and doesn’t die, they can make a {@dc 10} CON saving throw and instead drop to 1 hit point on a success.
The {@dc increase} by 5 each time this feature is used, resetting after a short rest.

trait.name: Gift of the Drowned Ones
entries: RAAAGH can breathe underwater.

trait.name: Danger Sense
entries: RAAAGH has advantage on DEX saving throws against effects they can see while not {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: RAAAGH has advantage on initiative rolls. If RAAAGH is surprised at the beginning of combat, they can act normally on their first turn if they enter a {@i {@b rage}} before anything else.

trait.name: Manifestations of the Deep
entries: RAAAGH gains one of the following benefits.

items: Eyes of the Deep. Once per short rest, RAAAGH casts the {@spell true seeing} spell, without using a spell slot or material components.

items.name: Soul of the Deep
items.entry: RAAAGH is immune to being {@i {@condition charmed}} or {@i {@condition frightened}}.

items.name: Armor of the Deep
items.entry: RAAAGH's skin hardens, increasing their Armor Class by 1.

entries: During a long rest they may replace the chosen manifestation.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, RAAAGH can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Eldritch Claw Tattoo
entries: RAAAGH's {@b {@i Talons}} attacks are magical for the purposes of damage resistances and immunities.

trait.name: Brutal Critical (2 Die)
entries: RAAAGH can roll two additional weapon damage dice for a critical hit with a melee attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: RAAAGH makes two attacks.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Ghostwater Dive
entries: RAAAGH magically teleports up to 30 feet, making one attack before or after teleporting. After teleporting all creatures within 10 feet of RAAAGH must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and is not knocked prone.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Dredge Line
entries: While {@b {@i raging}}, RAAAGH can target one creature within 15 feet. The target must succeed on a 14 STR saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet in a straight line towards RAAAGH.

bonus.name: Eldritch Maul (1/day)
entries: RAAAGH empower their strikes. For 1 minute, the range of all melee attacks becomes 15 feet, and their melee attacks deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage on a hit.

bonus.name: Rage (5/Long Rest)
entries: For up to 1 minute RAAAGH gains advantage on STR checks and saving throws, {@b +3} melee damage with STR weapons, and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing damage. This ends if RAAAGH falls {@condition unconscious} or chooses to end it as a bonus action.

monster.name: Ancient Gold Shadow Dragon

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Living Shadow
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the dragon has resistance to damage that isn't force, psychic, or radiant.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the dragon has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Ancient Gold Shadow Dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}, {@hit 17} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

items.name: {@b Shadow Breath}
items.entry: The dragon exhales shadowy mist in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 71 ({@damage 13d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: {@b Weakening Breath}
items.entry: The dragon exhales gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 25} Strength saving throw or have disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength checks, and Strength saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

bonus.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the dragon can take the Hide action.

legendaryHeader: The dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 ft. of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

monster.name: Syl, Usurper of Gods
immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Actor
entries: Syl has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks made to hide his identity.

trait.name: Cloak of Displacement
entries: Attack rolls against Syl have disadvantage until they take damage, at which point this property ceases to function until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Crossbow Expert
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on Syl's ranged attack rolls

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the Syl's darkvision.

trait.name: Eldritch Master (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Syl can spend 1 minute entreating their patron for aid to regain all the expended spell slots from thierr Pact Magic feature.

trait.name: Eldritch Mind
entries: Syl has advantage on Constitution saving throws that made to maintain concentration on a spell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/day)
entries: If Syl fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Syl has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Syl's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Velradin's Arcana
entries: All cantrips Syl casts act as if they are cast one tier higher than they are; either using an additional damage dice or targeting an additional creature.

trait.name: Agonizing Blast
entries: When Syl hits a creature with eldritch blast, each damage roll gets a +6 bonus.

trait.name: Fey Vision
entries: The Usurper's sees creatures in the range of their blindsight as if they were highlighted in a purple light, even if they are hidden or {@condition invisible}. Attack rolls against these highlighted creatures have advantage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Syl's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Syl is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). Syl has the following warlock spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Ritual Casting
headerEntries: Syl's ritual spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). The spells can be cast at will, taking 10 minutes longer to cast than normal:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Syl makes three attacks.

action.name: Shadow Gauntlets
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 5d8 + 7}) psychic damage. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's speed is reduced by half.

action.name: Revengence
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 80/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) magical piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 5d4 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Change Appearance
entries: Syl can change his appearance and voice. He determine the specifics of the changes and can adjust his height and weight, but must remain medium sized.
He stays in this new form until he uses an action to revert to his true form or until he dies.

action.name: Dark Delirium (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Syl chooses a creature to must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, it is {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} of Syl for 1 minute or until their concentration is broken, during which time the creature thinks it is lost in a misty realm, the appearance of which Syl chooses. The creature can see and hear only itself, Syl, and the illusion.

action.name: Fey Presence (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Syl causes each creature in a 10-foot cube to make a 20 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} until the end of his next turn.

action.name: Velradin's Favor (2/Long Rest)
entries: Syl regains one warlock spell slot.

bonus.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: Syl can command his familiar to take the Attack action.

reaction.name: Beguiling Defenses
entries: When another creature attempts to charm Syl he can force them to make a 20 {@dc Wisdom} saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

reaction.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: When Syl's familiar takes damage, they can to grant it resistance against that damage.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: In response to taking damage, Syl turns {@condition invisible} and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space they can see. They remains invisible until the start of his next turn or until Syl attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

legendaryHeader: The Usurper can take 5 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Syl regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Revengence
entries: Syl attacks with {@i {@b Revengence}}.

legendary.name: Misty Transport
entries: Syl uses {@spell misty step} without expending a spell slot.

legendary.name: Beguiling Misdirection
entries: Syl targets one creature they can see within 60 feet of them. The target must succeed a {@dc 16} or becomes {@condition charmed} by Syl and must use its reaction to move up to half its speed to point of Syl's choice that they can see.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Syl makes a natural weapon attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Syl expends a spell slot to cast a spell.

legendary.name: Misty Escape (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Syl recharges the use of their {@i {@b Misty Escape}}.

legendary.name: Shadow Gauntlets (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Syl attacks with their {@b {@i Shadow Gauntlets}}.

legendary.name: Revengence (Costs 2 Actions)

legendary.name: Master Strategist (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Roll d10 for Sylvester. Depending on their choice, the number rolled on the die is subtracted from an attack roll made against Sylvester or an ally of his choice or a saving throw roll made against Sylvester within the next minute. Alternatively, the number rolled can be added to Sylvester's next ability check, attack roll or saving throw within the next minute, if they so choose. Sylvester can keep up to 3 Master Strategist dies at a time.
