entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Change Appearance
entries: Sylvester can change his appearance and voice. He determine the specifics of the changes and can adjust his height and weight, but must remain medium sized.
He stays in this new form until he uses an action to revert to his true form or until he die.

action.name: Dark Delirium (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Sylvester chooses a creature to must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, it is {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} of Sylvester for 1 minute or until their concentration is broken, during which time the creature thinks it is lost in a misty realm, the appearance of which Sylvester chooses. The creature can see and hear only itself, Sylvester, and the illusion.

action.name: Fey Presence (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Sylvester causes each creature in a 10-foot cube to make a 20 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} until the end of his next turn.

action.name: Velradin's Favor (2/Long Rest)
entries: The Scholar regains one warlock spell slot.

bonus.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: Sylvester can command his familiar to take the Attack action.

reaction.name: Beguiling Defenses
entries: When another creature attempts to charm Sylvester he can force them to make a 20 {@dc Wisdom} saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

reaction.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: When Sylvester's familiar takes damage, they can to grant it resistance against that damage.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: In response to taking damage, Sylvester turns {@condition invisible} and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space they can see. They remains invisible until the start of his next turn or until Sylvester attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lich casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

trait.name: Far Realm Parasite
entries: Inside the lich's torso dwells a wormlike parasite that contains the lich's soul. When the lich dies, it implodes into the parasite, which then vanishes into the Far Realm. In {@dice 2d4} days, the parasite causes the lich to reappear within {@dice 1d4} miles of where it died. If the lich died inside a magic circle cast to contain Undead, the lich instead reappears as an {@creature otyugh} with all the lich's memories.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The lich doesn't need air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lich makes one Parasitic Tentacle attack or uses Spellcasting. The lich also uses Psychic Whisper twice.

action.name: Parasitic Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The third time the target fails the save, the target dies and dissolves into a {@creature gibbering mouther} that obeys the lich and uses the target's initiative.

action.name: Psychic Whisper
entries: The lich targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or take 25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the lich's next turn as incomprehensible whispers fill the target's mind.

reaction.name: Far Realm Step
entries: Immediately after taking damage, the lich, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede Osxian's darkvision.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Osxian has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Pact of the Talisman (3/Long Rest)
entries: When the wearer of Osxian's talisman fails a ability check, they can add 2 ({@damage 1d4}) to the roll, potentially turning the save into a success.

trait.name: Protection of the Talisman (3/Long Rest)
entries: When the wearer of Osxian's talisman fails a saving throw, they can add 2 ({@damage 1d4}) to the roll, potentially turning the save into a success.

trait.name: Eldritch Mind
entries: Osxian has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on a spell.

trait.name: Radiant Soul
entries: When Osxian casts a spell that deals radiant or fire damage, the spell gets a +4 damage bonus.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Osxian's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Osxian is a 7th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). Osxian has the following warlock spells prepared:
footerEntries: *spell that deals radiant or fire damage

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Boomerang
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) bludgeoning damage. On a miss, a boomerang returns to the thrower's hand.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Healing Light (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Osxian has a pool of 8d6's. They can heal one creature within 60 feet, by spending up to 4 dice from the pool.

trait.name: Empowered Healing (1/Turn)
entries: When Zansariph or an ally within 5 feet rolls dice restore hit points, Zansariph can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll any number of those dice once.

trait.name: Favored by the Gods (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If Zansariph fails a saving throw or miss with an attack roll, they can roll 2d4 and add it to the total, possibly changing the outcome.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Zansariph has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: Zansariph has 7 sorcery points. They can spend 1 or more sorcery points to gain one of the following benefits:

{@i Twinned Spell}: Zansariph can spend sorcery points equal to a spell's level (1 for a cantrip) to target a second creature in range with the same spell, as long as the spell at the level it's being cast is incapable of targeting more than one creature.
{@i Quickened Spell}: When Zansariph casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, they can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Zansariph is a 7th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). Zansariph has the following Sorcerer spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Agduraash Caigwyn

trait.name: Aura of Conquest
entries: A creature that is {@condition frightened} of the Tyrant within 10 ft. of them has its speed is reduced to 0 and it takes 8 psychic damage if it starts its turn there.

trait.name: Aura of Courage
entries: The Tyrant and friendly creatures within 10 ft. can't be {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Aura of Protection
entries: The Tyrant grant all friendly creatures within 10 ft. a +5 bonus to all saving throws.

trait.name: Divine Health
entries: The Tyrant is immune to disease.

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: When the Tyrant hits with a melee weapon attack, they can expend one spell slot to deal 9 ({@damage 2d8}) extra radiant damage to the target plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) for each spell level higher than 1st and and additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) against undead or fiends.

trait.name: Great Weapon Master
entries: When the Tyrant makes a melee attack with a heavy weapon, they can take a -5 penalty to the attack roll to add +10 to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Scornful Rebuke
entries: Whenever a creature hits the Tyrant with an attack, that creature takes +5 psychic damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Tyrant is a 16th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The Tyrant has the following paladin spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Tyrant makes two attacks.

action.name: Frost Tongue Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage. On a hit the attack does an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage and the targets speed is reduced by 10ft.

action.name: Javelin of Lightning (1/Day)
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 11 ({@damage 1d6 + 8}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage. Once per day, on a hit, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage. Each other creature in the line must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Tyrant uses one of the following abilities.

items.name: {@b Ice Breath}
items.entry: As an action the Tyrant exhales in a 15 ft. cone. Each creature in range must make a 17 {@dc Constitution} saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: {@b Dragon Roar}
items.entry: The Tyrant forces each creature of their choice within 30 feet to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute repeating the saving throw if it takes any damage.

action.name: Channel Divinity (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Tyrant uses their Channel Divinity in one of the following ways.

items.name: {@b Conquering Presence}
items.entry: As an action, the Tyrant forces each creature of their choice within 30 feet to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or becomes {@condition frightened} of the Tyrant for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: {@b Guided Strike}
items.entry: When the Tyrant makes an attack roll they can gain a +10 bonus to the roll.

action.name: Lay on Hands Pool (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The Tyrant have a pool of healing power that can restore 80 HP. The Tyrant can touch a creature to restore any number of HP remaining in the pool, or 5 HP to either cure a disease or neutralize a poison affecting the creature.

action.name: Cleansing Touch (5/Long Rest)
entries: The Tyrant ends one spell on themself or on a willing creature that they touch.

action.name: Divine Sense (6/Long Rest)
entries: Until the end of The Tyrant's next turn, they can sense anything affected by the hallow spell or know the location of any celestial, fiend, undead within 60 ft. that is not behind total cover.

bonus.name: Great Weapon Master
entries: When the Tyrant score a critical hit with a melee weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with one, they can make one melee weapon attack.

legendaryHeader: The Tyrant can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Tyrant regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Tyrant moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Tyrant makes a melee or ranged weapon attack.

legendary.name: Intimidate (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Tyrant chooses a creature within 30 ft. and makes a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check contested by the targets Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. On failure the target is {@condition frightened} until the end o it's next turn.

monster.name: Arthur Desmoreaux

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the Scholar's darkvision.

trait.name: Mobile
entries: When the Scholar makes a melee attack against a creature, they don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether the Scholar hits or not.

trait.name: Scholar's Grasp
entries: The Scholar has advantage on all Intelligence Checks made to recall information.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Scholar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Scholar is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The Scholar has the following warlock spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Scholar makes two attacks with their pact weapons.

action.name: Nighteye Dagger (Tyranthraxus the Flamed One)
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 12 ({@damage 1d4 + 10}) piercing damage. On a hit the attack does an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and the targets speed is reduced by 10ft. for one minute.

action.name: Pactbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: One with Shadows
entries: When the Scholar is in an area of dim light or darkness, they can use their action to become {@condition invisible} until they move or take an action or a reaction.

action.name: Create Pact Weapon
entries: As an action, the Scholar can create a pact weapon in their hand (the Scholar chooses the form, and is proficient with it, and it counts as magical). The Scholar can also transform a magic weapon into their pact weapon by performing a special ritual.

action.name: Radiant Flames (1/Day)
entries: Multi-hued flame surrounds the Scholar for 1 minute, until the wielder is {@condition incapacitated} or dies, or until the wielder extinguishes the flame (no action required). While inflamed, the wielder has telepathy with a range of 30 feet, and it can teleport as a bonus action up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. In addition, every creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the Scholar must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This ability can be used as a bonus action after the Scholar hits a creature with an attack with {@i {@b Nighteye Dagger (Tyranthraxus the Flamed One)}}, forcing the target of the attack to make the {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw.

action.name: Accursed Specter (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When the Scholar slay a humanoid, they can cause its spirit to rise from its corpse as a {@creature Specter|MM}. It gains 6 temporary hit points. It obeys the Scholar's verbal commands, and it gains a +4 bonus to its attack rolls. The {@creature Specter|MM} remains until the end of their next long rest.

action.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The Scholar regains one warlock spell slot.

bonus.name: Hexblade's Curse (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: One creature visible within 30 feet of the Scholar is cursed for 1 minute unless the target dies, the Scholar dies, or is {@condition incapacitated}.
Until then, they gain the following benefits:

items: The Scholar gains a 5 bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target.
Any attack roll the Scholar make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
If the cursed target dies, the Scholar regains +17 hit points

reaction.name: Armor of Hexes
entries: If the target cursed by the Scholar's Hexblade's Curse hits them with an attack roll, roll a d6. On a 4 or higher, the attack instead misses, regardless of its roll.

legendaryHeader: The Scholar can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Scholar regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Scholar moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Scholar makes a melee or ranged weapon attack.

legendary.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper
entries: The Scholar uses the {@i {@b Rod of the Pact Keeper}}.

legendary.name: Pact Weapon (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Scholar summons a pact weapon and attacks with it.

monster.name: Arthur, The Split Servant
immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Martial Prowess
entries: When using {@i {@b Two-Weapon Fighting}}, the Split Servant can make an additional 2 weapon attacks with and can add +6 to the damage rolls.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the Split Servant's darkvision.

trait.name: Mobile
entries: When the Split Servant makes a melee attack against a creature, they don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether the Split Servant hits or not.

trait.name: Scholar's Omniscience
entries: The Split Servant has triple advantage on all Intelligence Checks made to recall information.

trait.name: Stained Psyche
entries: The Split Servant is immune to any spell or effect that would read thier thoughts, determine if they are lying, charm or frighten it, or magically influence its thoughts or behavior, unless the spell or effect comes from {@b {@i Pandorym}}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Split Servant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The Split Servant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Split Servant is a 16th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks). The Split Servant has the following warlock spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Split Servant makes two attacks with their pact weapons.

action.name: Split Soul Nighteye Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 14 ({@damage 1d4 + 12}) piercing damage. On a hit the attack does an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage and the targets speed is reduced by 10ft. for 10 minutes.

action.name: Pactbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Create Pact Weapon
entries: As an action, the Split Servant can create a pact weapon in their hand (the Split Servant chooses the form, and is proficient with it, and it counts as magical). The Split Servant can also transform a magic weapon into their pact weapon by performing a special ritual.

action.name: Accursed Specter (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When the Split Servant slay a humanoid, they can cause its spirit to rise from its corpse as a {@creature Specter|MM}. It gains 6 temporary hit points. It obeys the Split Servant's verbal commands, and it gains a +6 bonus to its attack rolls. The {@creature Specter|MM} remains until the end of their next long rest.

action.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The Split Servant regains one warlock spell slot.

bonus.name: Hexblade's Curse (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: One creature visible within 30 feet of the Split Servant is cursed for 1 minute unless the target dies, the Split Servant dies, or is {@condition incapacitated}.
Until then, they gain the following benefits:

items: The Split Servant gains a 6 bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target.
Any attack roll the Split Servant make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
If the cursed target dies, the Split Servant regains +17 hit points

bonus.name: Blaze of Forbidden Knowledge
entries: The Split Servant can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. In addition, every creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the Split Servant must make a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw, taking 19 ({@damage 3d12}) radiant damage and 19 ({@damage 3d12}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This ability can be used as a free action after the wielder hits one creature with a weapon attack, forcing the target of the attack to make the {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw.

reaction.name: Armor of Hexes
entries: If the target cursed by the Split Servant's Hexblade's Curse hits them with an attack roll, roll a d6. On a 4 or higher, the attack instead misses, regardless of its roll.

legendaryHeader: The Split Servant can take 4 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Scholar regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Split Servant moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Pact Weapon
entries: The Split Servant summons a weapon and attacks with it.

legendary.name: Rod of the Pact Keeper
entries: The Split Servant uses the {@i {@b Rod of the Pact Keeper}}.

legendary.name: Psionic Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Split Servant casts a spell from their psionics spell list.

monster.name: Cachette

trait.name: Favored Enemy
entries: The Nomad has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track Aberrations, Humans, ELves and Monstrosities, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

trait.name: Gunner
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on the Nomad's ranged attack rolls.

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: The Nomad can move through nonmagical difficult terrain and nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them. The Nomad has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement.

trait.name: Natural Explorer
entries: When the Nomad make an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to Cities, the Coast, and the Underdark, the Nomad's proficiency bonus is doubled.

trait.name: Nomad's Boon
entries: The wielder has proficiency in checks using Vehicles (Land) and  Vehicles (Water). The Nomad has advantage on all Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}), Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks.

trait.name: Skulker
entries: The Nomad can try to hide when only lightly obscured. Missing a ranged weapon attack, doesn't reveal their position, and dim light doesn't impose disadvantage on their Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks relying on sight.

trait.name: Umbral Sight
entries: While in darkness, the Nomad is {@condition invisible} to any creatures that rely on darkvision to see them in that darkness.

trait.name: Dread Ambusher
entries: The Nomad has a {@b +4} bonus to initiative. For the first turn of each combat the Nomad's walking speed increases by 10ft, they can make an additional weapon attack as part of their {@i {@b Multiattack}} and that attack does an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.

trait.name: Feline Agility (Recharges after Moving 0 Feet in a Turn)
entries: The Nomad's speed doubles until the end of the turn.

trait.name: Stalker's Flurry (1/Turn)
entries: When the Nomad misses with a weapon attack, they can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.

trait.name: Cloak of the Bat
entries: The Nomad has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Nomad's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Nomad is a 16-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The Nomad has the following ranger spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nomad makes two attacks.

action.name: Nighteye Dagger (Borem of the Lake of Boiling Mud)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., or {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d4 + 11}) piercing damage. On a hit the attack does an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and the targets speed is reduced by 10ft. for one minute.

action.name: Oathbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) if the target is the Nomad's {@i sworn enemy}.

Once a day the Nomad can declare the target of the attack their {@i sworn enemy} until it dies or until dawn seven days later. When the Nomad's {@i sworn enemy} dies, they can choose a new one after the next dawn.

The Nomad makes ranged attack rolls with this weapon against their {@i sworn enemy}, with advantage. In addition, the target gains no benefit from cover, other than total cover, and the Nomad suffers no disadvantage due to long range.
While the Nomad's {@i sworn enemy} lives, they have disadvantage on attack rolls with all other weapons.

action.name: Net of Holding
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 20 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} and the {@i Net of Holding} can be moved as if it weighed 5 pounds. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 20} Strength check to free itself or another creature in a net, ending the effect on a success. Dealing 25 slashing damage to the net (AC 23) frees the target without harming it and destroys the net.

action.name: Borem's Embrace (1/Day)
entries: The Nomad touches one creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be coated in sticky, steaming mud. While it is coated in this way, the target's speed is halved, it can't use reactions, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The effect lasts for 1 minute, until the Nomad is {@condition incapacitated} or dies, or until the target is immersed in water. This ability can be used as a bonus action after the wielder makes a successful weapon attack with the {@i {@b Nighteye Dagger (Borem of the Lake of Boiling Mud)}}, forcing the target of the attack to make the saving throw.

bonus.name: Nature's Veil (5/Long Rest)
entries: The Nomad can magically become {@condition invisible} as until the start of their next turn.

bonus.name: Vanish
entries: The Nomad can use the Hide action and cannot be tracked by nonmagical means, unless they choose to leave a trail.

reaction.name: Shadowy Dodge
entries: Whenever a creature makes an attack roll against the Nomad without advantage, they can impose disadvantage on it.

legendaryHeader: The Nomad can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Nomad regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Nomad moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Feline Agility
entries: The Nomad regains the use of their Feline Agility.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Nomad makes a melee or ranged weapon attack.

monster.name: The Woman
immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Eyes Beyond Time
entries: The Stranger has advantage on Intelligence ({@skill History}) checks.

trait.name: Magical Resistance
entries: The Stranger has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Cloak of the Stranger
entries: The Stranger has a +1 bonus to saving throws.

trait.name: Stanger's Veil
entries: The Stranger has advantage on all checks made to hide their identity. In addition, after interacting with the Stranger, creatures must succeed a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or forget the interaction over the next few days. A creature attuned to a Nighteye Dagger automatically succeeds.

trait.name: Temporal Awareness
entries: The Stranger adds {@b +6} to their initiative rolls.

trait.name: War Caster
entries: The Stranger has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on a spell.

trait.name: Wreathed in the Unknowable
entries: The Stranger is hidden from divination magic and can't be perceived through magical scrying sensors. When a creature targets the Stranger using the scrying spell or similar spell, it must make a Wisdom saving throw against it's own save {@dc or} take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
entries: If the Stranger fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Abandon Corporal Form (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the Stranger is reduced to 0 hit points while wearing the {@item Chained Eye of Tharizdun|MPSOURCE}, they do not die or fall {@condition unconscious}. Instead, the take on a form of sheds her skin, regains 299 hit points, gains a fly speed of 40 ft. and teleports up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Stranger is an 19th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). The Stranger has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Ritual Casting
headerEntries: The Stranger's ritual spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). The spells can be cast at will, taking 10 minutes longer to cast than normal:

spellcasting.name: Spell Mastery
headerEntries: The Stranger's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, (80/320), one creature. {@h}[1d8+1] piercing damage.

action.name: Walk Through Planes
entries: The Stranger enters the {@i Astral Plane} and remains there until they use an action to return to the plane they were on. The Stranger reappears in the last space they occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space.

action.name: Momentary Stasis (6/day)
entries: The Stranger can force a Large or smaller creature within 60 feet to make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0 until the end of the Stranger's next turn or until the creature takes any damage.

action.name: Cloak of the Stranger (6 Charges; Recharges 1d6 at Dusk)
entries: By expending a charge, the Stranger casts {@spell magic missile} as a 5th-level spell {@i (7 missles)}.

action.name: Spell Absorption (5 charges; Resets to 0 at Dawn)
entries: When the Stranger is targeted by a spell of 3rd level or lower, they can choose to be unaffected and this cloak stores one charge. The Stranger can expend all stored charges to regain a spell slot of a level equal to or less that the number of charges expended.

bonus.name: Tharizdun's Bolt {@recharge 6}
entries: The Stranger selects one creature it can see that can see it with in 60 ft. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or experience short-term madness for 3 ({@damage 1d6}) * 10 minutes or long-term madness for 5 ({@damage 1d10}) hours. Consult the Short-Term and Long-Term Madness tables (see "Madness Effects" in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master's Guide) to determine the form of the madness. The affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of every 10 minutes if inflicted with short-term madness or at the end of each minute for long-term madness, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Chronal Shift (2/day)
entries: After anyone within 30 feet of the Stranger makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, they can force the creature to reroll. The target must use the result of the second roll.

reaction.name: Convergent Future
entries: When anyone makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, within 60 feet of the Stranger, they can use a reaction to ignore the die roll and decide whether the number rolled is the minimum needed to succeed or one less than that number. When the Stranger use this feature, they gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

reaction.name: War Caster
entries: When a creature's provokes an opportunity attack, the Stranger can cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack.

mythic.name: Confront Infinity
entries: Until the start of the Stranger's next turn, any creature that hits them with a melee attack ages 5 ({@damage 1d10}) years. Any ammunition the Stranger is hit with during this time becomes unusable.

mythic.name: Taxing Presence (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Stranger selects one creature within 30 ft. to make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving through or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}. If the target fails the save by 5 or more, they gain 2 levels of exhaustion. The Stranger loses levels of exhaustion equal to what the target gains.

mythicHeader: If the Stranger's mythic trait is active, it can use the options below as legendary actions for 1 hour after using Abandon Corporal Form.
legendaryHeader: The Stranger can take 5 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Stranger regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: The Stranger casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Reaction (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Stranger regains their reaction.

legendary.name: Tharizdun's Bolt (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Stranger recharges and uses {@i {@b Tharizdun's Bolt}}.

legendary.name: Cast Spell (Costs 1–3 Actions)
entries: The Stranger uses a spell slot to cast a 1st-, 2nd-, or 3rd-level spell that it has prepared. Doing so costs 1 legendary action per level of the spell.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, Zhihlah has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit Zhihlah scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Gunner
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on the Zhihlah's ranged attack rolls.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Zhihlah has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Warned
entries: Zhihlah has advantage on initiative rolls and cannot be surprised.

trait.name: Reliable Talent
entries: Whenever Zhihlah makes an ability check that lets them add their proficiency bonus, a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Zhihlah is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Zhihlah instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Zhihlah deals an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of the assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Zhihlah doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Zhihlah's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Dagger of Warning
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow + 1
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Zhihlah can take the following as actions: Dash, Disengage, or Hide.

bonus.name: Poisoner (4/Long Rest)
entries: Zhihlah can apply injury poison to a weapon. The poison lasts for 1 minute and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Zhihlah can halve the damage from an attack against them if they can see the attacker.

monster.name: Zhihlah

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the Thief has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the Thief scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the Thief is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the Thief instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Gunner
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on the Thief's ranged attack rolls.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Thief has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Thieve's Clutch
entries: The Thief has advantage on all Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks and checks made with Thieves' Tools.

trait.name: Reliable Talent
entries: Whenever the Thief makes an ability check that lets them add their proficiency bonus, a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

trait.name: Sharpshooter
entries: The Thief ignores cover when making ranged attacks. They can also take a -5 penalty to an attack to do an additional 10 damage.

trait.name: Warned
entries: The Thief has advantage on initiative rolls and cannot be surprised.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The Thief deals an extra 31 ({@damage 9d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of the assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the Thief doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Death Strike
entries: When the Thief attacks and hits a creature that is surprised, the target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take double the damage from the attack.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Thief's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Toxic Nighteye Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 15 ({@damage 1d4 + 13}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage, the targets speed is reduced by 10ft. for one minute and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Rapier + 1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Longbow of Warning
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 600 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Leer of Corruption {@recharge 6}
entries: The Thief hits one creature with a weapon attack. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 5d10}) necrotic damage and be {@condition poisoned} for 10 minutes. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of each minute, ending the effect on itself on a success. This ability can be used as a free action after the wielder makes a successful weapon attack with the {@i {@b Toxic Nighteye Dagger}}, forcing the target of the attack to make the saving throw.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Thief can take the following as actions: Dash, Disengage, or Hide.

bonus.name: Poisoner (6/Long Rest)
entries: Thief can apply injury poison to a weapon. The poison lasts for 1 minute and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: The Thief can halve the damage from an attack against them if they can see the attacker.

legendaryHeader: The Thief can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Thief regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Shift
entries: The Thief moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Vanish
entries: The Thief performs a Hide action. It can move up to half its speed before or after this action.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Thief makes a melee or ranged weapon attack.

trait.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: The {@i Combat Optimized Martial Personnel And Survival Savant} has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Natural Explorer
entries: When the C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit makes an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to Grasslands, the C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit's proficiency bonus is doubled.

trait.name: Umbral Sight
entries: While in darkness, the C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit is {@condition invisible} to any creatures that rely on darkvision to see them in that darkness.

trait.name: Favored Enemy
entries: The C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) and Intelligence checks to track and recall information about elves and humans.

trait.name: Dread Ambusher
entries: The C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit has a +1 bonus to initiative. For the first turn of each combat the C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit's walking speed increases by 10ft, they can make an additional weapon attack and that attack does an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Shortsword

trait.name: Dread Ambusher
entries: The C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit has a +2 bonus to initiative. For the first turn of each combat the C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit's walking speed increases by 10ft, they can make an additional weapon attack and that attack does an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.

trait.name: Sharpshooter
entries: Before making a ranged weapon attack, C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit can choose to take a {@b -5} penalty to the attack roll to add {@b +10} to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Favored Enemy
entries: The C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) and Intelligence checks to track and recall information about elves, humans and one creature type of your choice.

trait.name: Natural Explorer
entries: When the C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit makes an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to Grasslands or mountains, the C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit's proficiency bonus is doubled.

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs the C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit no extra movement. They can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.
In addition the C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such those created by the {@spell entangle} spell.

trait.name: Stalker's Flurry
entries: Once per turns, when the C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit misses a weapon attack, they can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The C.O.M.P.A.S.S. Unit's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Slasher
entries: Once per turn, when the C.U.D.G.E.L. Unit deals slashing damage, they can reduce the target's speed by 10 feet until the start of the C.U.D.G.E.L. Unit's next turn.
When the C.U.D.G.E.L. Unit scores a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls until the start of the C.U.D.G.E.L. Unit's next turn.

trait.name: Remarkable Athlete
entries: The C.U.D.G.E.L. Unit can add {@b +2} to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check that doesn't already use their proficiency bonus.
They can cover an additional {@b +5} feet when making a running long jump.

trait.name: Sentinel
entries: Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from the C.U.D.G.E.L. Unit even if they take the Disengage action before leaving their reach. When the C.U.D.G.E.L. Unit hits a creature with an opportunity attack, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: The C.U.D.G.E.L. Unit's weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The {@i Combat Unit Designated as Guardian and Emperor's Legionary} can take one additional action on their turn.

trait.name: Indomitable (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: C.U.D.G.E.L. Unit can reroll a saving throw that they fail but must use the new roll.
