items.name: {@b Turn Undead}
items.entry: Each undead within 30 feet of the S.C.A.L.P.E.L. Unit must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature spends its turns moving as far away from the S.C.A.L.P.E.L. Unit as it can, can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of the S.C.A.L.P.E.L. Unit, take reactions, and only take the dash action, escape from an effect that prevents it from moving, or take the Dodge action if there's nowhere to move.

trait.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: The D.E.A.C.O.N. has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Blessed Disciple
entries: When the {@i Designated Emissary of Alkor Chosen to Orate and Nurse} casts a healing spell on another creature, they both regain HP equal to 2 + the spell's level.

trait.name: Supreme Healing
entries: When the D.E.A.C.O.N. would normally roll dice to restore hit points with a spell, they instead use the highest number possible for each die.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The D.E.A.C.O.N. is a 17th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The D.E.A.C.O.N. has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Mace, +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Channel Divinity (3/Short Rest)
entries: The D.E.A.C.O.N. uses their Channel Divinity in one of the following ways.

items.name: {@b Preserve Life}
items.entry: The D.E.A.C.O.N. restores 85 HP spread among any creatures within 30 ft. of them. Creatures cannot be healed past half of its hit point maximum.

items.name: {@b Turn Undead}
items.entry: Each undead within 30 feet of the D.E.A.C.O.N. must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature spends its turns moving as far away from the D.E.A.C.O.N. as it can, can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of D.E.A.C.O.N., take reactions, and only take the dash action, escape from an effect that prevents it from moving, or take the Dodge action if there's nowhere to move. When an undead of CR {@b 4} or lower fails its saving throw, the creature is instantly destroyed.

trait.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E. has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Slasher
entries: Once per turn, when the L.E.G.A.T.E. deals slashing damage, they can reduce the target's speed by 10 feet until the start of the L.E.G.A.T.E.'s next turn.
When the L.E.G.A.T.E. scores a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls until the start of the L.E.G.A.T.E.'s next turn.

trait.name: Remarkable Athlete
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E. can add {@b +3} to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check that doesn't already use their proficiency bonus.
They can cover an additional {@b +6} feet when making a running long jump.

trait.name: Sentinel
entries: Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from the L.E.G.A.T.E. even if they take the Disengage action before leaving their reach. When the L.E.G.A.T.E. hits a creature with an opportunity attack, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E.'s weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

trait.name: Survivor
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E. regains {@b +9} hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and less than {@b 110} hit points.

trait.name: Evasion of the Empire
entries: When the L.E.G.A.T.E. triggers attacks of opportunity, those attacks are made with disadvantage.

trait.name: Action Surge (2/Short Rest)
entries: The {@i Leadership Exclusive Guard Automaton and Tactical Expert} can take one additional action on their turn.

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Long Rest)
entries: L.E.G.A.T.E. can reroll a saving throw that they fail but must use the new roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: L.E.G.A.T.E. makes three attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) slashing damage, or 13 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 8 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Nimbleness of the Empire
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E. can to take the Dash action.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E. can to regain 23 ({@damage 1d10 + 18}) HP.

reaction.name: Protection
entries: The L.E.G.A.T.E. can impose disadvantage on an attack roll from a creature they can see again a target within 5 feet of the L.E.G.A.T.E..

reaction.name: Sentinel
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the L.E.G.A.T.E. makes an attack against another target (without the {@i Sentinel} feat), the L.E.G.A.T.E. can make a melee weapon attack against the attacking creature.

trait.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: The {@i Regal Enforcer Galvanizing Exemplary Neutralization Tactics} has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Crusher
entries: Once per turn, when the R.E.G.E.N.T. deals bludgeoning damage, they can move the target's speed by 5 feet to an unoccupied space.
When the R.E.G.E.N.T. scores a critical hit that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against the target have advantage until the start of the R.E.G.E.N.T.'s next turn.

trait.name: Great Weapon Master
entries: Before making a melee attack with a heavy weapon, the R.E.G.E.N.T. can choose to take a {@b -5} penalty to the attack roll to add {@b +10} to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Remarkable Athlete
entries: The R.E.G.E.N.T. can add {@b +3} to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check that doesn't already use their proficiency bonus.
They can cover an additional {@b +5} feet when making a running long jump.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: The R.E.G.E.N.T.'s weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The R.E.G.E.N.T. can take one additional action on their turn.

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Long Rest)
entries: The R.E.G.E.N.T. can reroll a saving throw that they fail but must use the new roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The R.E.G.E.N.T. makes three attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d8 - 1}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The R.E.G.E.N.T. can to regain 20 ({@damage 1d10 + 15}) HP.

trait.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: The {@i Survival Crossing Optimized Utility Tracker} has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Umbral Sight
entries: While in darkness, the S.C.O.U.T. is {@condition invisible} to any creatures that rely on darkvision to see them in that darkness.

trait.name: Dread Ambusher
entries: The S.C.O.U.T. has a +2 bonus to initiative. For the first turn of each combat the S.C.O.U.T.'s walking speed increases by 10ft, they can make an additional weapon attack and that attack does an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.

trait.name: Sharpshooter
entries: Before making a ranged weapon attack, S.C.O.U.T. can choose to take a {@b -5} penalty to the attack roll to add {@b +10} to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Favored Foe (5/Long Rest)
entries: When the S.C.O.U.T. hits a creature with an attack roll, they can mark the target as their favored enemy for 1 minute or until they lose concentration. The first time the S.C.O.U.T. hits their favored enemy on each of their turns the hut does an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs the S.C.O.U.T. no extra movement. They can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.
In addition the S.C.O.U.T. has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such those created by the {@spell entangle} spell.

trait.name: Stalker's Flurry
entries: Once per turns, when the S.C.O.U.T. misses a weapon attack, they can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The S.C.O.U.T.'s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The S.C.O.U.T. is a 16th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). S.C.O.U.T. has the following ranger spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The S.C.O.U.T. makes two attacks.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tireless (5/Long Rest)
entries: The S.C.O.U.T. can give themself 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) temporary hit points.

bonus.name: Nature's Veil (5/Long Rest)
entries: The S.C.O.U.T. can magically become {@condition invisible}, until the start of theirr next turn.

bonus.name: Vanish
entries: On each of its turns, the S.C.O.U.T. can take the Hide action. The S.C.O.U.T. can also not be tracked by non magical means.

reaction.name: Shadowy Dodge
entries: The S.C.O.U.T. imposes disadvantage on an attack roll a creature makes against them without advantage on the roll.

trait.name: Danger Sense
entries: The Arc Fighter has advantage on DEX saving throws against effects they can see.

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: The Arc Fighter has advantage on initiative rolls. Also, the Arc Fighter can act normally when surprised if they enter a rage before doing anything else.

trait.name: Relentless Rage
entries: If the Arc Fighter drops to 0 hit points while raging and they don't die, they can make a DC {@b 10} CON saving throw. If they succeed, they drop to 1 hit point instead. The {@dc increase} by 5 each time the Arc Fighter uses this after the first, resetting to {@b 10} after a short or long rest.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of their turn, the Arc Fighter can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against they have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Storm Soul
entries: The Arc Fighter gain resistance to lightning damage and can breathe underwater and their swimming speed becomes 30 feet.

trait.name: Shielding Storm
entries: Each creature the Arc Fighter chooses gains resistance to lightning damage while the creature is in the Storm Aura.

trait.name: Brutal Critical
entries: The Arc Fighter rolls one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.

trait.name: Slasher
entries: Once per turn when hitting a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, the Arc Fighter can reduce the speed of the target by 10 feet until the start of their next turn.
When the Arc Fighter scores a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls, until the start of the Arc Fighter's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Arc Fighter makes two attacks.

action.name: Greataxe, +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Rage (4/Long Rest)
entries: Enter a rage for up to 1 minute (10 rounds). The Arc Fighter gains advantage on STR checks and saving throws (not attacks), {@b +3} melee damage with STR weapons, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing damage. The rage ends early if they are knocked {@condition unconscious} or if their turn ends and they haven't attacked a hostile creature since their last turn or taken damage since then. The Arc Fighter can also end the rage as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Strom Aura
entries: This can be activated as a part of a rage, or while raging. When this effect is activated, the Arc Fighter can choose one other creature they can see in their aura to make a {@dc 16} DEX save taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage and taking half damage on a successful save.

reaction.name: Stone's Endurance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Arc Fighter can reduce damage dealt to them by 10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4})

trait.name: Manifest Mind - Cast Spell (4/Long Rest)
entries: When casting a wizard spell, the Lightning Scribe can cast it from the spectral tome's space.

trait.name: Arcane Recovery (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When finishing a short rest, the Lightning Scribe can recover expended spell slots - up to a combined level of {@b 5}, and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.

trait.name: Awakened Spellbook
entries: When casting a wizard spell of 4th level or lower, the Lightning Scribe can replace its damage type lightning damage.

trait.name: Elemental Adept
entries: Spells cast by the Lightning Scribe ignore resistance to lightning damage and, when rolling lightning damage for a spell they cast, any 1 on a damage die is treated as a 2.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Lightning Scribe is a 11th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability for wizard spells is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The Lightning Scribe has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Ritual Casting
headerEntries: The Lightning Scribe's ritual spellcasting ability for wizard spells is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The spells can be cast at will, taking 10 minutes longer to cast than normal:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Cleric)
headerEntries: The Lightning Scribe's spellcasting ability for cleric spells is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The Lightning Scribe has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Longsword, +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Channel Divinity (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Lightning Scribe uses their Channel Divinity in one of the following ways.

items.name: {@b Destructive Wrath}
items.entry: When the Lightning Scribe rolls lightning or thunder damage, they can use their Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.

items.name: {@b Turn Undead}
items.entry: Each undead within 30 feet of the Lightning Scribe must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature spends its turns moving as far away from the Lightning Scribe as it can, can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of the Lightning Scribe, take reactions, and only take the dash action, escape from an effect that prevents it from moving, or take the Dodge action if there's nowhere to move.

bonus.name: Manifest Mind (Recharges after a Long Rest; or a Spell Slot is spent to use it)
entries: A Tiny spectral tome hovers in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the Lightning Scribe. It sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius and disappears if it is 300 feet away from them. While manifested, the tome can hear and see, has 60 ft. of darkvision and can telepathically share with Lightning Scribe what it sees and hears (no action required).
As a bonus action, the tome to hover up to 30 feet. It can pass through creatures but not objects.

reaction.name: Stone's Endurance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Lightning Scribe can reduce damage dealt to them by 8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2})

reaction.name: Wrath of the Storm (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When a creature hits the Lightning Scribe with an attack, the creature to make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning or thunder damage on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Manifest Mind - Cast Spell (4/Long Rest)
entries: When casting a wizard spell, the Boltscrawler can cast it from the spectral tome's space.

trait.name: Arcane Recovery (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When finishing a short rest, the Boltscrawler can recover expended spell slots - up to a combined level of {@b 5}, and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.

trait.name: Awakened Spellbook
entries: When casting a wizard spell of 7th level or lower, the Boltscrawler can replace its damage type lightning damage.

trait.name: Elemental Adept
entries: Spells cast by the Boltscrawler ignore resistance to lightning damage and, when rolling lightning damage for a spell they cast, any 1 on a damage die is treated as a 2.

trait.name: Storm Queen's Prowess
entries: The Boltscrawler has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration.

trait.name: Manifest Mind - One with the Word
entries: The Boltscrawler has advantage on all Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) checks.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Boltscrawler is a 16th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability for wizard spells is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The Boltscrawler has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Ritual Casting
headerEntries: The Boltscrawler's ritual spellcasting ability for wizard spells is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The spells can be cast at will, taking 10 minutes longer to cast than normal:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Cleric)
headerEntries: The Boltscrawler's spellcasting ability for cleric spells is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The Boltscrawler has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Boltscrawler makes two attacks.

action.name: Lightning Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}40 ({@damage 9d6 + 9}) lightning damage.

action.name: Wind Javelin
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 30 ({@damage 6d6 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Channel Divinity (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Boltscrawler uses their Channel Divinity in one of the following ways.

items.name: {@b Destructive Wrath}
items.entry: When the Boltscrawler rolls lightning or thunder damage, they can use their Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.

items.name: {@b Turn Undead}
items.entry: Each undead within 30 feet of the Boltscrawler must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature spends its turns moving as far away from the Boltscrawler as it can, can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of the Boltscrawler, take reactions, and only take the dash action, escape from an effect that prevents it from moving, or take the Dodge action if there's nowhere to move.

bonus.name: Manifest Mind (Recharges after a Long Rest; or a Spell Slot is spent to use it)
entries: A Tiny spectral tome hovers in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the Boltscrawler. It sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius and disappears if it is 300 feet away from them. While manifested, the tome can hear and see, has 60 ft. of darkvision and can telepathically share with Boltscrawler what it sees and hears (no action required).
As a bonus action, the tome to hover up to 30 feet. It can pass through creatures but not objects.

reaction.name: Stone's Endurance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Boltscrawler can reduce damage dealt to them by 11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5})

reaction.name: Wrath of the Storm (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When a creature hits the Boltscrawler with an attack, the creature to make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning or thunder damage on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Manifest Mind - One with the Word (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When the Boltscrawler takes damage while {@b {@i Manifest Mind}} is active, they can dismiss it to prevent all the damage. Then roll 10 ({@damage 3d6}). The spellbook temporarily loses spells that have a combined spell level equal to that roll or higher. The spells cannot be recast for 3 ({@damage 1d6}) days.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Captain's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. The Captain can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the Captain has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the Captain scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: The Captain can take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the Captain is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the Captain instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the Captain can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the Captain is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifer.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The Captain deals an extra 17 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the Captain that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the Captain doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Stunning Strike (4/Day)
entries: Once per turn, when the Captain hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can force the creature to make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Lucky
entries: When the Captain roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, they can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Captain has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries: The Captain can move through the space of any creature that is medium or larger.

trait.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: The Captain can attempt to hide even when they are obscured only by a creature that is medium or larger.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Captain makes three attacks: one with its dagger and two of which can be an unarmed strike or a dart attack.

action.name: Nighteye Dagger - II
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d4 + 9}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Cloak of Shadows
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the Captain becomes {@condition invisible} until it makes an attack. cast a spell, or is in an area of bright light.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: The Captain halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The Captain must be able to see the attacker.

trait.name: Lucky Footwork
entries: Ches can add 2 ({@damage 1d4}) when making a Dexterity saving throw.

trait.name: Hare Trigger
entries: Ches gains a {@b +3} bonus to initiative.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Ches can take one additional action on their turn.

trait.name: Arcane Shot (2/Short Rest)
entries: Ches can apply an Arcane Shot Option to an arrow when they make a ranged weapon attack

items.name: {@b Piercing Arrow}
items.entry: The shot goes passes through a 30 foot long line and creatures in it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage or half as much on a successful save.

items.name: {@b Blinding Shot}
items.entry: The shot does an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be unable to see anything farther than 5 feet away until the start of Ches's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ches makes two attacks.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Ches can regain 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) HP.

bonus.name: Rabbit Hop (3/Long Rest)
entries: Ches can jump 15 ft. without provoking opportunity attacks.

monster.name: Soul of the Talisman
immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
languages: Common plus up to two other languages

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Ta-lich-man fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the {@i {@b Talisman}} is not destroyed, the Ta-lich-man gains a new body in 5 ({@damage 1d10}) days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the {@i {@b talisman}}.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The Ta-lich-man has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Grave Touched (1/Turn)
entries: Once during each of their turns, when the Ta-lich-man hits a creature with an attack roll, they can replace the damage type with necrotic damage. While using {@b {@i Form of Dread}}, the Ta-lich-man can roll one additional damage die of necrotic damage.

trait.name: Pact of the Talisman (6/Long Rest)
entries: While wearing the amulet, when the Ta-lich-man fails an ability check or saving throw, it can add a 2 ({@damage 1d4}) to the roll, potentially turning the roll into a success.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The Ta-lich-man doesn't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Ta-lich-man is an 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The lich has the following warlock spells prepared:

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@i Melee Spell Attack:} 12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@i Hit:} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} 18 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spirit Projection (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The Ta-lich-man can project its spirit from their body. The body left behind is {@condition unconscious} and in a state of suspended animation. Any damage or other effects that apply to its spirit or physical body affects the other. While projecting its spirit, the Ta-lich-man gains the following benefits:

items: Both spirit and body gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
When casting a spell of the conjuration or necromancy school, the spell doesn't require verbal or somatic components or material components that lack a gold cost.

The Ta-lich-man has a flying speed of 30 ft. walking speed and can hover. It can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, but takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside a creature or an object.
While using its {@i {@b Form of Dread}}, once during each of its turns when dealing necrotic damage, the Ta-lich-man regains hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

entries: The Ta-lich-man's spirit can remain outside its body for up to 1 hour or until concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). When this projection ends, this spirit returns to the body or the body magically teleports to the spirit's space (your choice).

bonus.name: Form of Dread (6/Long Rest)
entries: The Ta-lich-man manifests an aspect of their patron's dreadful power, transforming for 1 minute, gaining the following benefits:

items: The Ta-lich-man gains temporary hit points equal to 25 ({@damage 1d10 + 20}).
The Ta-lich-man becomes immune to necrotic damage

Once during each of their turns, when Ta-lich-man hit a creature with an attack roll, they can force it to make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, or be {@condition frightened} of the Ta-lich-man until the end of it's next turn.
The Ta-lich-man is immune to the frightened condition.

entries: The Ta-lich-man's {@b {@i Form of Dread}} appears as a shroud of shadows masking eyes emanating incomprehensible whispers.

reaction.name: Necrotic Husk (Rechages after 1d4 Long Rests)
entries: When the Ta-lich-man would be reduced to 0 hit points, it can drop to 1 hit point instead and cause its body to erupt with deathly energy. Each creature of their choice, within 30 feet of it takes 31 ({@damage 2d10 + 20}) necrotic damage. The Ta-lich-man gains 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.

legendaryHeader: The lich can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The lich regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: The Ta-lich-man casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Ta-lich-man uses its {@i {@b Paralyzing Touch}}.

legendary.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lich fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the lich's gaze for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each non-undead creature within 20 feet of the Ta-lich-man must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 21 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendaryGroup.name: Veldarin
regionalEffects: The region containing Veldarin's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Shadows come to life within 6 miles of the Archmage of Alyentlea's lair. Most of the time these living shadows are unnerving and nothing more, but when a creature acts against the interests of Veldarin, the shadows can interfere and cause any relevant die roll to be made with disadvantage.
Magic saturates the area within 6 miles of the lair, causing minor random effects similar to a prestidigitation cantrip.
Veldarin can cast their senses to any area containing darkness, dim light, or shadows within 6 miles of their lair, similar to a clairvoyance spell.

regionalEffects: If Veldarin dies, the first two effects fade over the course of 2d10 days.
lairActions: When fighting inside its lair, Veldarin can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Veldarin can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: Veldarin wills darkness to overpower the light. All bright light sources in the lair shed only dim light to their normal bright light radius, and dim light sources are extinguished. This lasts until Veldarin dismisses the effect or dies.

An opaque wall of writhing shadows springs up from a solid surface within 120 feet of Veldarin. The wall is up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick. Each creature in the area must make a successful {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. Creatures in the wall's space are pushed 5 feet out of the wall's space, appearing on whichever side of the wall they choose. A creature can move through the wall, but the semimaterial shadow resists intrusion. For every foot a creature travels through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. Furthermore, any creature that, during its own turn, occupies any part of the wall's space takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. Each 10-foot section of wall has AC 5, 15 hit points, vulnerability to radiant damage, resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage, and immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage. The wall lasts until Veldarin uses this lair action again, or until she dies.

Veldarin targets one creature within 60 feet of her and assails its mind with visions of hopelessness and despair. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until initiative count 20 on the next round.

legendaryGroup.name: Captain Tefor
lairActions: When fighting inside their Castle, the Tyrant and Ice Queen can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the monster can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: The Caigwyn's summon one of the royal guard to assist in the battle. Guards summoned this way act at a group initiative that is rolled when the first one is summoned. When a guard is close to death, they flee, but if they are killed before fleeing, the guards make a {@dc 15} group Wisdom saving throw or all flee on their turn.

The Caigwyn's targets one creature either can see within 60 feet of it and challenge its force of will. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to leave its current space. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

An icicle falls from the ceiling which lands on a square area of ground within the lair, covering it with ice. The area can be up to 10 feet on a side. The ice lasts for 1 hour or until it is melted away with fire. When the ice appears, each creature on it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) cold damage, fall {@condition prone} and slide 10 feet in a random direction determined by a d8 roll. A creature that succeeds the saving takes half as much damage and is not knocked prone. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, that creature must make the same save, taking no damage on a success.

legendaryGroup.name: Ancient Gold Shadow Dragon
regionalEffects: The region containing a legendary gold dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Whenever a creature that can understand a language sleeps or enters a state of trance or reverie within 6 miles of the dragon's lair, the dragon can establish telepathic contact with that creature and converse with it in its dreams. The creature must make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or remembers its conversation with the dragon and be be {@condition frightened} upon waking for 2 ({@damage 1d4}) days.

Banks of sickly, shadowy mist manifest within 6 miles of the dragon's lair. The mist lightly obscures the area. It assumes haunting forms when good creatures are near the dragon or other non-evil creatures in the mist, warning such creatures of the danger.
Gems and pearls within 1 mile of the dragon's lair lose color and start to give off a wispy, shadowy smoke.

regionalEffects: If the dragon dies, these effects end immediately.
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The dragon glimpses the future, so it has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until initiative count 20 on the next round.

One creature the dragon can see within 120 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be banished to a dream plane, a different plane of existence the dragon has imagined into being. To escape, the creature must use its action to make a Charisma check contested by the dragon's. If the creature wins, it escapes the dream plane. Otherwise, the effect ends on initiative count 20 on the next round. When the effect ends, the creature reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that one is occupied.

legendaryGroup.name: Syl
regionalEffects: The region containing the Usurper's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Magic saturates the area within 6 miles of the lair, causing minor random effects similar to a prestidigitation cantrip.

The warforged army thoroughly patrols within 6 miles of the Syl's lair. Most of the time these soldiers are intimidating and nothing more, but when a creature acts against the interests of the Syl, the warforged can interfere and cause any relevant die roll to be made with disadvantage.
Syl can cast access the senses of any soldier within 6 miles of their lair, similar to a clairvoyance spell.

regionalEffects: If Syl dies, the first two effects fade over the course of 2d10 days.
lairActions: When fighting inside its lair, Syl caFn invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Syl can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: Syl wills darkness to overpower the light. All bright light sources in the lair shed only dim light to their normal bright light radius, and dim light sources are extinguished. This lasts until Syl dismisses the effect or dies.

An opaque wall of writhing shadows springs up from a solid surface within 120 feet of Syl. The wall is up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick. Each creature in the area must make a successful {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. Creatures in the wall's space are pushed 5 feet out of the wall's space, appearing on whichever side of the wall they choose. A creature can move through the wall, but the semimaterial shadow resists intrusion. For every foot a creature travels through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. Furthermore, any creature that, during its own turn, occupies any part of the wall's space takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. Each 10-foot section of wall has AC 5, 15 hit points, vulnerability to radiant damage, resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage, and immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage. The wall lasts until Syl uses this lair action again, or until they die.

The Syl summons a warforged soldier to act as a companion in battle (your choice of unit). Roll 1d6. On a roll of 1-3, the soldier has a level of 4. On a roll of 4 or 5, the soldier has a level of 8. On a roll of 6, 2 level 8 soldiers appear.

legendaryGroup.name: Tyrant
lairActions: When fighting inside their Castle, the Tyrant and Ice Queen can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the monster can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: The Caigwyn's summon one of the royal guard to assist in the battle. Guards summoned this way act at a group initiative that is rolled when the first one is summoned. When a guard is close to death, they flee, but if they are killed before fleeing, the guards make a {@dc 15} group Wisdom saving throw or all flee on their turn.

The Caigwyn's targets one creature either can see within 60 feet of it and challenge its force of will. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to leave its current space. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

An icicle falls from the ceiling which lands on a square area of ground within the lair, covering it with ice. The area can be up to 10 feet on a side. The ice lasts for 1 hour or until it is melted away with fire. When the ice appears, each creature on it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) cold damage, fall {@condition prone} and slide 10 feet in a random direction determined by a d8 roll. A creature that succeeds the saving takes half as much damage and is not knocked prone. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, that creature must make the same save, taking no damage on a success.

legendaryGroup.name: Stranger
lairActions: When fighting inside its lair, the Stranger can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Stranger can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: The Stranger rolls a d8 and regains a spell slot of that level or lower. If they have no spent spell slots of that level or lower, nothing happens.
The Stranger targets one 30 ft circle within 60. Blinky is forced to project its eye in that direction and that area is under the effect of the {@i anti-magic field} spell until the next turn.

The Stranger exacerbates a temporal anomaly in its lair. This abnormality materializes around one creatures they can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 52 ({@damage 15d6}) force or psychic damage (your choice) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. The anomaly then disappears.

{@b Available after using {@i Abandon Corporal Form}} The Stranger creates a chronurgic ward around itself that remains until initiative count 20 on the next round or until the Stranger is no longer in the their lair. While the ward is active, whenever the Stranger takes damage, they instead take half the damage (rounded down). The ward erupts in a 15 sphere centered on the Stranger and each creature must make e a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take the remaining damage on a failed save.

item.name: Veldarin's Pact Baton
entries: While holding this rod, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your warlock spells.
In addition, being attuned to this rod grants the following abilities.

items.name: Veldarin's Favor
entries: This item has 2 charges. You can expend a charge as an action and regain a warlock spell slot while holding the rod. All expended uses recharge when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Veldarin's Protection
entries: You gain resistance to Psychic, Necrotic, and Radiant Damage. You are also immune to being {@condition frightened}.

items.name: Veldarin's Arcana
entries: When attuned to this rod, all cantrips you cast act as if they are cast at a tier greater than they are. This means using an additional damage dice or having an additional target.

item.name: Cloak of the Stranger
item.reqAttune: requires attunement by an evil wizard of level 17 or higher
entries: A deep black fabric with silver and violet accents and runes flecked with bright dots remeniscent if a clear night's sky. The elegance of the cloak is juxtaposed by the scorched hem that hangs just above the ground. Through years of experimentation {@creature The Stranger|MPSource} was able to improve upon the already magically potent {@item Robe of the Archmagi|DMG} she procured from a Warlock of old.

Six stars, dotted across the cloak, are particularly large. As an action you can extinguish a star to cast {@spell magic missile} as a 5th-level spell. Daily at dusk, {@damage 1d6} extinguished stars reignite on the robe.

While you wear the robe, you can use an action to enter the Astral Plane along with everything you are wearing and carrying. You remain there until you use an action to return to the plane you were on. You reappear in the last space you occupied, or if that space is occupied, the nearest unoccupied space.
You gain these benefits while wearing the robe:

items: If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 15 + your Dexterity modifier + your Intelligence modifier.
Your spell save DC and spell attack bonus each increase by 3.
You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws while you wear it.

item.name: Chained Eye of Tharizdun
entries: A fragment of a dagger infused with the power of {@b Tharizdun the Chained God}. This object has been manipulated and worked to heighten it's power to levels before thought impossible.

entries.name: Tharizdun the Chained God
entries: While attuned the wielder is known as {@b The Stranger} and has access to the following abilities:

items.name: Elder Evil's Asylum
entries: The wearer has immunity to all Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing Damage from Nonmagical Attacks and resistance to all Bludgeoning, Piercing and Slashing Damage.

items.name: Eldritch Immortality
entries: The wielder's hit point maximum increases by 8 for each level they have and and increases by 8 again whenever they gain a level.
The wielder's Constitution score is 21. This has no effect on if their Constitution is already 21 or higher without them.

items.name: Mental Barrier
entries: The wearer has resistance to all Psychic damage.

items.name: Stanger's Mask
entries: The wielder gains proficiency with Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks if they did not have it already and gains expertise with those skills. The wearer has advantage on all checks made to hide their identity. In addition, after interacting with the wielder, creatures must succeed a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or forget the interaction over the next day. A creature attuned to a {@item Nighteye Dagger|MPSource} automatically succeeds.

items.name: Wreathed in the Unknowable
entries: The wearer is hidden from divination magic and can't be perceived through magical scrying sensors. When a creature targets the wearer using the {@spell scrying} spell or similar spell, it must make a Wisdom saving throw against it's own save DC or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage.

items.name: Blessing of Tharizdun.
entries: When the wielder takes damage, it can use its reaction to force each hostile creature within 10 feet of it to make a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes half the damage the cultist took as psychic damage.

items.name: Tharizdun's Bolt {@recharge 6}
entries: As a bonus action, the wielder selects one creature it can see that can see it with in 60 ft. The creature must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or experience The creature must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or experience short-term madness for {@dice 1d6*10} minutes or long-term madness for {@dice 1d10} hours. Consult the Short-Term Madness table (see "{@book Madness|dmg|8|Madness}" in chapter 8 of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|dmg}) to determine the form of the madness. The affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each minute, ending the effect on itself on a success.
When a non-evil creature uses this ability is inflicted with the same madness as the target creature.

item.name: Nighteye Dagger - I
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

You can use an action action to connect the blade to the endless expanse. The connection remains until for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d8} cold damage and have their movement reduced by 10ft for 1 turn. The dagger can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Nighteye Dagger - II
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

You can use a bonus action to connect the blade to the endless expanse. The connection remains until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature takes an additional {@damage 2d8} cold damage and their movement is reduced by 10ft for 1 turn. The dagger can't be used this way again until the next dawn.
When a weapon attack made with this weapon hits, it deals additional damage equal to half the attacker's proficiency bonus rounded down.

item.name: Nighteye Dagger - III
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When a weapon attack made with this weapon hits, it deals additional damage equal to the attacker's proficiency bonus as well as an additional {@damage 2d8} cold damage. Creatures that take this damage have their movement reduced by 10ft for 1 minute. This can be cured with the use of the lesser restoration spell or a similar or spell that ends a magical effect.

item.name: Nighteye Dagger - Borem
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When a weapon attack made with this weapon hits, it deals additional damage equal to the attacker's proficiency bonus as well as an additional {@damage 2d8} cold damage. Creatures that take this damage have their movement reduced by 10ft for 1 minute. This can be cured with the use of the lesser restoration spell or a similar or spell that ends a magical effect.

entries.name: Borem of the Lake of Boiling Mud
entries: While attuned the wielder is known as {@b The Nomad} and has access to the following abilities:

items.name: Elder Evil's Protection
entries: The wielder has resistance to all Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing Damage from Nonmagical Attacks.

items.name: Eldritch Resilience
entries: The wielder's hit point maximum increases by 2 for each level they have and and increases by 2 again whenever they gain a level.

items.name: Nomad's Boon
entries: The wielder gain proficiency in {@item Vehicles (Land)}, {@item Vehicles (Water)}, and Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks if they did not have it already. The wielder has advantage on all Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}), Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks. In addition your Wisdom score increases by 2, as does your maximum for that score.

items.name: Borem's Embrace (1/Day)
entries: The wielder touches one creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or be coated in sticky, steaming mud. While it is coated in this way, the target's speed is halved, it can't use reactions, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The effect lasts for 1 minute, until the wielder is incapacitated or dies, or until the target is immersed in water.
This ability can be used as a bonus action after the wielder hits one creature with a weapon attack, forcing the target of the attack to make the saving throw.

When a non-evil creature uses this ability they must maintain concentration or a creature is released from the mud. They also take 4 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage each round a creature is coated in mud.

item.name: Nighteye Dagger - Haask
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When a weapon attack made with this weapon hits, it deals additional damage equal to the attacker's proficiency bonus as well as an additional {@damage 2d8} cold damage. Creatures that take this damage have their movement reduced by 10ft for 1 minute. This can be cured with the use of the lesser restoration spell or a similar or spell that ends a magical effect.

entries.name: Haask the Voice of Hargut
entries: While attuned the wielder is known as {@b The Tyrant} and has access to the following abilities:

items.name: Elder Evil's Protection
entries: The wielder has resistance to all Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing Damage from Nonmagical Attacks.

items.name: Eldritch Resilience
entries: The wielder's hit point maximum increases by 2 for each level they have and and increases by 2 again whenever they gain a level.

items.name: Tyrant's subjugation
entries: The wielder gain proficiency in Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks if they did not have it already. Creatures have disadvantage on saving throws and ability checks made to avoid being charmed or frightened by the wielder. In addition your Charisma score increases by 2, as does your maximum for that score.

items.name: Haask's Presence (1/Day)
entries: The wielder transforms into a Tiny, leech-like being and teleports onto the shoulder of a humanoid that it can see within 30 feet of it. The targeted humanoid must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be charmed by the wielder. While the target is charmed, the wielder has control of it on the target's next turn. At the end of that turn, the wielder teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it and returns to its normal form. The wielder can't be targeted directly by any attack or other effect while it's in the slug-like form, but it is subject to areas of effect as normal.
This ability can be used as a bonus action after the wielder hits one creature with a weapon attack, forcing the target of the attack to make the saving throw.
When a non-evil creature uses this ability they take 7 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage each when they transform into the leech.

item.name: Nighteye Dagger - Tharizdun
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When a weapon attack made with this weapon hits, it deals additional damage equal to the attacker's proficiency bonus as well as an additional {@damage 2d8} cold damage. Creatures that take this damage have their movement reduced by 10ft for 1 minute. This can be cured with the use of the lesser restoration spell or a similar or spell that ends a magical effect.

entries.name: Tharizdun the Chained God
entries: While attuned the wielder is known as {@b The Stranger} and has access to the following abilities:

items.name: Elder Evil's Protection
entries: The wielder has resistance to all Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing Damage from Nonmagical Attacks.

items.name: Eldritch Resilience
entries: The wielder's hit point maximum increases by 2 for each level they have and and increases by 2 again whenever they gain a level.

items.name: Stanger's Mask
entries: The wielder gains proficiency with Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks if they did not have it already. The wielder has advantage on all checks made to hide their identity. In addition, after interacting with the wielder, creatures must succeed a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or forget the interaction over the next few days. A creature attuned to a {@item Nighteye Dagger|MPSource} automatically succeeds.

items.name: Tharizdun's Spark {@recharge 6}
entries: As a bonus action, the wielder makes an attack with this weapon. The creature hit by the touched weapon must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or experience short-term madness for 10 minutes. Consult the Short-Term Madness table (see "Madness Effects" in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master's Guide) to determine the form of the madness. The affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each minute, ending the effect on itself on a success.
When a non-evil creature uses this ability they take 6 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage each when another creature is inflicted with madness this way.

item.name: Nighteye Dagger - Tyranthraxus
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When a weapon attack made with this weapon hits, it deals additional damage equal to the attacker's proficiency bonus as well as an additional {@damage 2d8} cold damage. Creatures that take this damage have their movement reduced by 10ft for 1 minute. This can be cured with the use of the lesser restoration spell or a similar or spell that ends a magical effect.

entries.name: Tyranthraxus the Flamed One
entries: While attuned the wielder is known as {@b The Scholar} and has access to the following abilities:

items.name: Elder Evil's Protection
entries: The wielder has resistance to all Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing Damage from Nonmagical Attacks.

items.name: Eldritch Resilience
entries: The wielder's hit point maximum increases by 2 for each level they have and and increases by 2 again whenever they gain a level.

items.name: Scholar's Grasp
entries: The wielder gain proficiency in Intelligence saving throws if they did not have it already. The wielder has advantage on all Intelligence Checks made to recall information. In addition the wielder Intelligence score increases by 2, as does their maximum for that score.

items.name: Radiant Flames (1/Day)
entries: Multi-hued flame surrounds the wielder for 1 minute, until the wielder is incapacitated or dies, or until the wielder extinguishes the flame (no action required). While inflamed, the wielder has telepathy with a range of 30 feet, and it can teleport as a bonus action up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. In addition, every creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the wielder must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
This ability can be used as a bonus action after the wielder hits one creature with a weapon attack, forcing the target of the attack to make the DC 15 Dexterity saving throw.
When a non-evil creature uses this ability they take 7 ({@damage 1d12}) fire damage each round they are inflamed.

item.name: Nighteye Dagger - Atropus
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When a weapon attack made with this weapon hits, it deals additional damage equal to the attacker's proficiency bonus as well as an additional {@damage 2d8} cold damage. Creatures that take this damage have their movement reduced by 10ft for 1 minute. This can be cured with the use of the lesser restoration spell or a similar or spell that ends a magical effect.

entries.name: Atropus the World Born Dead
entries: While attuned the wielder is known as {@b The Theif} and has access to the following abilities:

items.name: Elder Evil's Protection
entries: The wielder has resistance to all Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing Damage from Nonmagical Attacks.

items.name: Eldritch Resilience
entries: The wielder's hit point maximum increases by 2 for each level they have and and increases by 2 again whenever they gain a level.

items.name: Thieve's Clutch
entries: The wielder gains proficiency with thieves' tools and Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks if they did not have it already. The wielder has advantage on all Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks and checks made with {@item Thieves' Tools}. In addition your Dexterity score increases by 2, as does your maximum for that score.

items.name: Gaze of Corruption {@recharge 6}.
entries: The wielder targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage and be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
This ability can be used as a bonus action after the wielder hits one creature with a weapon attack, forcing the target of the attack to make the saving throw.
When a non-evil creature uses this ability they take 4 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage and can only poison one creature at a time.

item.name: Toxic Nighteye Dagger
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When a weapon attack made with this weapon hits, it deals additional damage equal to the attacker's proficiency bonus as well as an additional {@damage 2d8} cold damage. Creatures that take this damage have their movement reduced by 10ft for 1 minute. This can be cured with the use of the lesser restoration spell or a similar or spell that ends a magical effect.

entries.name: Atropus the World Born Dead
entries: While attuned the wielder is known as {@b The Theif} and has access to the following abilities:

items.name: Elder Evil's Protection
entries: The wielder has resistance to all Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing Damage from Nonmagical Attacks.

items.name: Eldritch Resilience
entries: The wielder's hit point maximum increases by 2 for each level they have and and increases by 2 again whenever they gain a level.

items.name: Thieve's Clutch
entries: The wielder gains proficiency with thieves' tools and Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks if they did not have it already. The wielder has advantage on all Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand) checks and checks made with {@item Thieves' Tools}. In addition your Dexterity score increases by 2, as does your maximum for that score.

items.name: Leer of Corruption {@recharge 6}.
entries: The wielder targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 5d10}) necrotic damage and be {@condition poisoned} for 10 minutes. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of each minute, ending the effect on itself on a success.
This ability can be used as a free action after the wielder hits one creature with a weapon attack, forcing the target of the attack to make the saving throw.
When a non-evil creature uses this ability they take 17 (5d6) poison damage and can only poison one creature at a time.
